title: Woman who ran over pedestrian at South Bay Mall had 15 used needles in handbag, authorities say
author: John Waller
bullets: Ariella Bezan, 25, charged with serious bodily injury while driving under drug influence at South Bay Mall.
Bezan's bail set at $1,500; ordered to complete drug treatment; court appearance scheduled for Sept. 24.
Officers found 15 used needles, paraphernalia in Bezan's car; victim hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries.

title: Should we hope that Mike Vrabel’s debut as Patriots coach goes as well as Jerod Mayo’s did? Actually, yes.
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Vrabel's debut as Patriots' head coach is against the Raiders, following a challenging previous season.
Jerod Mayo's brief coaching era ended after one season, with a promising start but only four wins.
Rookie running backs Ashton Jeanty and TreVeyon Henderson debut, expected to be major offensive contributors.

title: A Mass. historical home tour just ranked the best in the U.S.
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: The House of the Seven Gables in Salem ranked as the best historical house tour by Newsweek.
This 1668 mansion inspired Nathaniel Hawthorne's novel and is a National Historic Landmark since 2007.
The site attracts over 100,000 visitors annually, offering tours and events with a $25-$30 admission fee.

title: 10 burning questions about the 2025 Patriots ahead of their season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots, under new head coach Mike Vrabel, start the season against the Raiders with an overhauled roster.
Top draft pick Will Campbell is set to make his debut as left tackle, facing Raiders' pass-rusher Maxx Crosby.
Key players include rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson and 31-year-old receiver Stefon Diggs post-ACL surgery.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge of current events in Greater Boston.
The quiz covers trending stories and aims to keep participants informed about local developments.
General Assignment Editor Peter Chianca has been with Boston.com since 2019, contributing to various editorial roles.

title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox place reliever Jordan Hicks on 15-day injured list due to shoulder injury before facing the Diamondbacks.
Hicks struggled in an 8-1 loss to the Guardians, holding an 8.20 ERA over 21 appearances with Boston.
The Red Sox acquired Hicks in a trade with the Giants, raising concerns about his future, despite a $12 million contract.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics face a challenging 2025-26 season after trading starters Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis due to financial constraints.
Superstar Jayson Tatum's Achilles injury sidelines him, further complicating team dynamics for returning players Derrick White and Jaylen Brown.
White emphasizes adaptation, noting the need to integrate new players while maintaining competitiveness despite lowered championship expectations.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington Police concluded that reports of an 11-year-old approached by a masked man were unfounded.
Investigation included witness interviews and surveillance review, revealing insufficient evidence for further action.
Police Chief Julie Flaherty announced the closure of the case after determining no credible threat.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica faces assault and civil rights charges for threatening pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge.
Freeman allegedly used a hatchet and threatened to 'kill' protesters, referring to them with slurs during the August 10 incident.
Prosecutors charged Freeman with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon and a civil rights violation in Cambridge District Court.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie left tackle Will Campbell is limited in practice with an ankle injury ahead of Sunday's opener.
Christian Gonzalez is likely out, and DT Christian Barmore is limited but not injury-related before the Raiders game.
New England lacks depth at left tackle, raising concerns if Campbell can't play against the Raiders' Maxx Crosby.
